intro: Demetria glutinosa, commonly known as sticky leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its glossy, sticky leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
